column4: when I try to mount my cdrom, it says "you must specify the filesysystem type". now what filesystem does the cdrom have, any could help me??
Usually   "iso9660"
but which device is it?
the iso9660 said "rong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sr0, missing codepage or helper program, or other error In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try  dmesg | tail  or so"
this the output of "dmesg | tail -5" http://pastebin.com/m4fff1cf5

when i try to mount the cdrom with "sudo mount -t iso9660 /dev/sr0 /media/cdrom" it says "the "rong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sr0, missing codepage or helper program, or other error In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try  dmesg | tail  or so", any help

You could use the lshw package and command to confirm the device file for your cdrom drive.  And you could try different media for which you are more certain of the filesystem type and image integrity.
and the output of "dmesg | tail -5" http://pastebin.com/m4fff1cf5
how do I comprehend the output of lshw, it says this about the cdrom http://pastebin.com/m3fbed5d5
It certainly looks like /dev/sr0 should work for that sony dvd drive.  Perhaps you should be suspicious of the disc that you put into it.
the dvd is fine
A dvd is likely to be "udf" filesystem.  A cd is more likely to be "iso9660".  You said before that you had a "cdrom".
err..its a dvd rom and i'm inserting a dvd
well with udf mount option too, its giving the same error of wrong filesystem type
At this point I would test with another disc.  And check the first one for scratches and smudges.
well I've tested it with another disk too
with another dvd using udf filesystem?
yes
well i tried with a few dvds, while I dint have problem mounting a cd
is there a problem with the dvdrom, might it read a cd but not a dvd properly?

I am running low on suggestions.  If you have a lot of hard disk space you could try copying the raw image to a file.  It may produce something you could loop mount.  It would probably produce some interesting errors. ;-)
but how to copy something from the dvd if its not mounted?
dd if=/dev/sr0 of=my.iso bs=1M     or just     cat /dev/sr0 > my.iso
